title: In CarNage I Bloom... Like A FlowEr In The Dawn...
body:
Where are the last 5 syllables?...

obviously jhin's a poet and riot doesnt know it.

replies.body:
It was said by some Rioter(don't remember which one exactly, sorry) that Jhin actually had several Haikus in his VO that didn't make it into the game, among other things. Its probably like Kindred's poem, though, in the sense that it doesn't end.

Though, honestly, Jhinkus are far superior.

Yeah.  there were about a dozen haiku's recorded. But they violated the game's ratings level, so were omited. 

RE: The above. Most of the characters I wrote VO for have defined syllabic and speaking patterns.   (Because real people tend to speak in patterns determined by the complexity of their thoughts, comfort level, energy level, and lung capacity.)

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Gg2jJvIJ,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2019-03-18T19:38:19.671+0000)
>
> Yeah.  there were about a dozen haiku's recorded. But they violated the game's ratings level, so were omited. 
> 
> RE: The above. Most of the characters I wrote VO for have defined syllabic and speaking patterns.   (Because real people tend to speak in patterns determined by the complexity of their thoughts, comfort level, energy level, and lung capacity.)

Pray tell, what on earth were those haikus that they violated the rating level? Can you share them here, since the internet is not beholden to the ratings system?

count: one, two, three, four
count while i wipe the floor with
these motherfuckers

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Gg2jJvIJ,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2019-03-18T19:38:19.671+0000)
>
> Yeah.  there were about a dozen haiku's recorded. But they violated the game's ratings level, so were omited. 
> 

Can you share them on here then?

> Yeah. there were about a dozen haiku's recorded. But they violated the game's ratings level, so were omited.

Tell us those haikus? I really wanna know, as a fan of Jhin.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Gg2jJvIJ,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2019-03-18T19:38:19.671+0000)
>
> Yeah.  there were about a dozen haiku's recorded. But they violated the game's ratings level, so were omited. 
> 
> RE: The above. Most of the characters I wrote VO for have defined syllabic and speaking patterns.   (Because real people tend to speak in patterns determined by the complexity of their thoughts, comfort level, energy level, and lung capacity.)

What resources did you use to learn how to detail speech patterns?
on another note how can i put japanese vo in the game without changing client language

I didn't notice woah
 

I heard a lot of Jhins haikus were too visceral and gory for European audiences amongst... nearly any other ratings board while remaining pg13 or equivalent. 
Legend has it, Riot has them sitting around the office somewhere, in a file marked **[REDACTED]**

This is  quote of Japan server,
"さつりくの:In carnage
なかでわたしは:I am in
さきほこる:blooming proudly
（夜明けの花のように:Like a flower In the dawn...）”
Thanks to this post I noticed this.
